definition: lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
surname Yan
to lie supine/to stop/to fall down
flag/variant of 旗[qi2]
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]

sentences.english: During the period of Principate, the Roman army underwent two important changes.
sentences.chinese: 进入帝国时期以后，罗马的扩张活动基本上偃旗息鼓。

sentences.english: The love of war has gone AWOL at National Review.
sentences.chinese: 国家评论上的战争贩子也已经偃旗息鼓了。

sentences.english: Lately a lull seems to have descended on that struggle.
sentences.chinese: 最近这斗争似乎偃旗息鼓了。

to retreat/to shrink back
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
(do sth) on a large scale
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
hibernation/living in seclusion
repeatedly
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
